title: Bank of Khyber says will establish wholly-owned EC
summary: The Board of Directors of Bank of Khyber BoK announced on Friday that it will establish an Exchange Company EC as a whollyowned subsidiary becoming the 10th banking entity to make such an announcement to date The State Bank of Pakistan SBP in line with its regulatory directives has encouraged banks to establish currency exchange companies to facilitate and improve the currency exchange and related financial services through formal banking channels read the notice Accordingly Board of Directors of the Bank of Khyber in their meeting held on Friday November 03 2023 has approved for establishment of an EC with an authorized share capital of Rs1000 million subject to approval and clearance from SBP and completion of other regulatory compliance requirements it added As part of these reforms leading banks actively engaged in foreign exchange business will establish whollyowned Exchange Companies EC to cater to the legitimate foreign exchange needs of general public said the SBP in a statement As per the banks latest financial results BoK announced a profit before tax of Rs 4682 million for 9MCY23

title: Bank of Khyber to set up exchange company with Rs1bn initial capital
summary: The Bank of Khyber PSX BOK announced on Friday that it will set up a whollyowned Exchange Company with an initial paidup capital of up to Rs1 billion Read This Big banks are all set to run the open market BOKs initiative is a crucial component of a wider campaign by the State Bank of Pakistan SBP aimed at curbing illicit activities within the underground market The SBP issued noobjection certificate NOC to ABL and MCB for establishing their exchange companies Notably Habib Bank Limited HBL and the National Bank of Pakistan NPB had ventured into exchange companies before the implementation of these new SBP regulatory measures

title: Bank of Khyber’s profit shoots to Rs3.5bn, 665% higher YoY in 2023
